intro: Pelargonium × keglevicsianum, commonly known as the Keglevics geranium, is a hybrid species within the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and compact size. Pelargonium × keglevicsianum is also valued for its resilience and ability to tolerate various growing conditions.
